content:
# It appears that the copper furnace did not produce any copper plates, as our inventory still only contains stone. The copper furnace is currently working but has not yielded any results from the copper ore we inserted.

# The furnace has 9 units of copper ore remaining, indicating that it may not have enough coal to smelt the entire amount or there could be another issue at play.

# Given that we have 9 units of coal left in the furnace, we should insert an additional unit of coal to ensure that the smelting process can continue without interruption.

insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace_copper, quantity=1)  # Insert one more coal into the copper furnace

# After inserting the coal, we will monitor the furnace again for a maximum of 30 seconds to see if it produces any copper plates this time.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum wait time for smelting
    if inspect_inventory(furnace_copper)[Prototype.CopperPlate] >= 2:  # Check if we have at least 2 copper plates
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Copper smelting timeout - check inputs.")

# Finally, we should check the inventory and the status of the entities again.
print(f"Final Inventory: {inspect_inventory()} after smelting copper plates.")  # Final inventory check
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()} after smelting copper plates.")  # Check entity status again.
